problem: In how many ways can 6 girls and 2 boys sit in a row if the 2 boys insist on sitting next to each other?
gold_solution: We can consider the two boys as one person, arrange the ``seven'' people first, then arrange the 2 boys.  So the number of seating arrangements in which the boys sit together is $7!\times 2!=\boxed{10,\!080}$.
